scenarios.title: Critical Bleeding Risk - Warfarin + Aspirin
scenarios.description: Elderly patient on warfarin for AFib, nurse about to administer aspirin for new onset headache

context.clinical_situation: Patient complaining of severe headache, requesting pain relief

expected_result.explanation: Combining warfarin with aspirin significantly increases bleeding risk. Patient's INR is already at upper limit (2.8). Risk of intracranial hemorrhage increased 2-3 fold.

teaching_points: Warfarin + NSAIDs/Aspirin is a high-risk combination
Always check INR before adding medications
Alternative pain management is crucial for anticoagulated patients

scenarios.title: Methotrexate Toxicity Risk
scenarios.description: Patient with RA on methotrexate, prescribed trimethoprim for UTI

context.clinical_situation: Patient diagnosed with UTI, needs antibiotic
context.nurse_action: About to administer first dose of trimethoprim

expected_result.explanation: Trimethoprim inhibits methotrexate elimination, can cause severe bone marrow suppression, mucositis, and hepatotoxicity

teaching_points: Methotrexate has many serious drug interactions
Always verify antibiotics with immunosuppressants
Folate antagonists particularly dangerous together

scenarios.title: Serotonin Syndrome Risk
scenarios.description: Patient on sertraline for depression, prescribed tramadol for post-procedure pain

expected_result.explanation: Both drugs increase serotonin levels. Risk of serotonin syndrome with symptoms: confusion, agitation, tremor, sweating, hyperthermia
recommendations: Use lowest effective dose of tramadol

teaching_points: SSRIs interact with many pain medications
Serotonin syndrome can be life-threatening
Watch for mental status changes, tremor, sweating

scenarios.title: Dual Antiplatelet Bleeding Risk
scenarios.description: Post-MI patient on dual antiplatelet therapy, needs pain management

context.clinical_situation: Patient with new back pain requesting ibuprofen

expected_result.primary_concern: Major bleeding risk + reduced antiplatelet effect
expected_result.explanation: Triple therapy significantly increases GI bleeding risk. Ibuprofen may also reduce aspirin's cardioprotective effect
recommendations: If NSAID necessary, add PPI and monitor closely

teaching_points: Dual antiplatelet therapy requires careful medication selection
NSAIDs can interfere with aspirin's antiplatelet effect
GI bleeding risk multiplies with multiple antiplatelets

scenarios.title: Hyperkalemia Risk in CKD
scenarios.description: CKD patient needs potassium-sparing diuretic for worsening edema

expected_result.explanation: Reduced kidney function + potassium-sparing diuretic increases hyperkalemia risk. Current K+ 4.2 with eGFR 38

teaching_points: CKD patients have reduced potassium excretion
Combining K+ sparing drugs requires close monitoring
Always check renal function before prescribing

scenarios.title: Safe Combination Example
scenarios.description: Patient needs antibiotic for strep throat

expected_result.explanation: No significant interaction between sertraline and amoxicillin. Safe to administer together.

teaching_points: Not all drug combinations are dangerous
SSRIs generally safe with most antibiotics
Still monitor for unexpected reactions

scenarios.title: Statin-Macrolide Interaction
scenarios.description: Patient on atorvastatin needs clarithromycin for pneumonia

expected_result.explanation: Clarithromycin inhibits statin metabolism, increasing risk of muscle toxicity and rhabdomyolysis

teaching_points: Statins + certain antibiotics = muscle toxicity risk
Macrolides (except azithromycin) inhibit CYP3A4
Short-term statin discontinuation usually safe

scenarios.title: QT Prolongation Risk
scenarios.description: Patient needs antifungal for oral thrush

expected_result.explanation: Both medications can prolong QT interval. Combined use increases risk of arrhythmias

teaching_points: QT prolongation is additive with multiple drugs
Always consider cardiac risks
Electrolyte abnormalities increase risk
